Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2011 07:35PM dmho wrote: gardeeena,   yes I did I was so stress out from the time I  had my biopsy till the time I had my first surgery I lost close to 20 pounds just because I was too stress to eat right. I am sorry you are having to go through this, Take a deep breathe and try and relax. If the stress stays this bad you might need to talk to your doctor about giving you something to help you relax. They can give you a small dose that you only take when you really need it and it really does help. I would not have made it with out them. I will be sending good thoughts your way and B9 thoughts too. HUGS to you.

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2010 08:18PM dmho wrote: Well this part of the waiting is over. I was never call so I go in tomorrow for a core needle biopsy. I feel like I have been on a emotional roller coaster. I want to cry one minute and the next I am biting someone head off. I am scared out of my mind. I am not so much afraid of the biopsy as the results. I have had a fear of getting BC since I was a teenage and saw how it affect my grandma. I keep telling myself the changes are slim but I can not convince myself of it. I know this sounds silly. I now have to wait till next tuesday or wednesday to find out the results. I think I will be a real basket case by then!  Thanks to everyone on this site just having it and the post to read and see how other people have handle things have helped.Best Wishes to all.
Posts.Title: I am so stressed out!!!! dmho Lawleigh

Posts.Content: dmho wrote: I have had a bloody discharge from my left breast for over two years. Over time it has gone from only being once in a while to every day. After I had for a while I had a mammogram and an ultrasound both which come back normal. I was told just to keep an eye on it. I recently had a second mammogram which also come back normal. Since the discharge is worse I decided to see a specialist. She order a new ultrasound and a ductagram. This time they found a mass. I have been told they want to do a core biopsy. I asked why that instead of just a surgical biopsy and they said they need to know if it is cancerous to know how to remove it. For two years I have been fine and not worried now I feel that something is really wrong. I get the feeling that my doctor is not telling me something. It could be just that I am now stressing out. Any advice? Dx 11/17/2010, DCIS, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 1, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I am so stressed out!!!! dmho Lawleigh

I was ok till they changed the way they want to do they biopsy. They first told me they would remove the whole mass then when my BS called they had changed it. Thanks for all the support from this site. I feel much better now.

Posts.Title: I am so stressed out!!!! dmho Lawleigh

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2010 04:32PM dmho wrote: I just had my ultrasound biopsy done yesterday. Thankfully it was done in the afternoon so I was able to go home after wards. I agree with the suggestion of a sports bra. It has helped. The loud noise is scary if you do not know it is coming so ask them to tell you when it will happen. Each time they took a sample they told me so I was ready. After they were finished they placed a marker so if they need to do anything else they can find the same spot easier I guess. Then after wards they did a mammo. When the told me they would going to do one I about freaked out because I thought how would I able to handle that but they do not fully compress it. I not sure if they do this every time or not. just want to mention they might.I did not feel a thing. Best mommo I ever had!!!  Good luck I will me sending you good vibes.

She smiles when she feels like screaming And she sings when she feels like crying. she cry's when she's happy and laughs when she's afraid. Her love is unconditional. There's only one thing wrong with her, She forgets what she's worth! Pass this to every beautiful woman you know. Remind her she is unique. L-O-V-E-Y-O-U. Posts.Title: I have a possible diagnose dmho marie5890

Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2010 12:15PM dmho wrote: msphil I hope you have a Merry Christmas too. I had my follow up appt today. did not find much out. I guess they are still waiting on the some of the reports. My BS told me the really do not matter till I am finish with radiation anyway and am deciding on if I will take any meds. Has anyone else been told that? I did find out that they remove an 5.5 x 4.3 x 2.2 cm segment and there was DCIS present at the lateral margin, is less than 1mm from the inferior margin and less than 2mm from the posterior margin. She is now calling it intermediate grade DCIS. She did not say if that was still stage 0. She said we would know more after the surgery on Friday.So I guess it is back to waiting. I am really scared. I do not now why this time I am scared of the surgery. Last time I was scared of what they would find but this time I am really scared of the surgery. I am so close to not doing it. I know I am being unreasonable but I can not calm my fears. even my anti anxiety meds are not helping. Sorry to carry on like this but I am afraid to say anything to my family and I need some to talk to.

I guess I will know more after the MRI.

I was numb for days after hearing and trying to tell my family was awful.I have just been diagnoised with DCIS. This site has been a blessing.  One thing I learn on this site that helped me to remember things said at appt. is to take a recorder with you. Then record what the doctor says. Then once you feel up to it you can listen to  and then anything you missed you have. I am sorry your news was not good. I will be sending you caring thoughts and lots of HUGS.

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2010 02:31AM dmho wrote: Just want to let you know how yesterday went. sorry I did not make it on before now. This second time as not been as easy as the first. I have a killer headache and a sore throat. Plus this time the site is very painful. Last time it did not hurt much. I was able to get by with only taking pain pills a couple of times last time then took Tylenol. This time I am still take the pain pills. My BS said it went well. Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2011 08:40PM dmho wrote: I saw my PS today. He said losing the drain over the weekend did not hurt anything, but he was not ready to take the other two out yet. He also said that it look the skin were it was bruised is dying and they might have to remove it. I hope it is just taking it own time to heal. I did hear from my BS that all they found was DCIS and my node was neg.The nurse would not say anything about how close it was to the skin so I will have to wait till next week when I see her. I guess this week is a week of waiting. I am glad to hear how well everyone is doing. I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers. HUGS to all. Best wishes.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2011 06:26PM dmho wrote: Got home from hospital today. The surgery yesterday to take the TE out went well. They could get me in sooner by just using a local and the doctor says he removes TE all the time under a local. So I said sure. Them taking out the TE was not that big of a deal but the suctioning out of all the infection was another thing. they said I would feel better within 24 hours well I am still wanting. the muscle spasms have gotten worse. I have done nothing but sleep for two days. I seem to only wake up for a five to ten minutes at a time. I would expect this if I had a general but not with a local. I am glad to be home. 8 days in the hospital for a simple outpatient surgery was to much. They said we would talk about starting over after I have had time to heal in about six months but then they say that they whole thing could of been from my body rejecting the TE. But the only way to know is try again. At this point I do not want to ever go through what I have just been through again so I am not sure. I guess I have six months to decide. I hope everyone is doing well. Best wishes to all. HUGS
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2011 06:53AM dmho wrote: Hi ibcmets,  You said you had trouble with morphine making you throw up. Just want to let you know I started out that way years back after a minor surgery , the doctor told me it was nothing.Then the next time I had surgery it was a hysterectomy and I became violently ill, Turns out I was allergic to it. When I told the second doctor about the first time he said I should have been told then that I was. Just wanted to let you know that you might watch it.

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2011 12:39PM dmho wrote: hi everyone slinky glad your surgery went well. Redsky sorry to here you were not able to do yours ghope you are feeling better. My surgery went well. they took one node.  the pain was not bad monday and yesterday but today I am not feeling well. I can hardly use my left arm. Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2011 02:18AM dmho wrote: Sorry I have not checked in. I had my surgery wed. to remove the dead skin from around the incision sight, it was suppose to be a simple in and out thing. I ended up in the hospital were I still am. I woke up in recovery with a fever of 101.8. my normal temp is 97.4 and it takes a lot for me to run a fever. They were worried about infection so stuck me in for over night. My PS came to see me Thursday morning talking about sending me home with antibiotics since I was no longer running a fever. Then he takes a look at the fluid in the drain and decides he wants to culture it. then after looking at the sight which he says looks good but feels warm he has decided I need to be seen by an infectious disease doctor. They have determined I have a staph infection they just do not know which strand so basically which antibiotic to treat it with. This morning the nurse tells me I have reached the "danger level" for Tylenol so I have only taken muscle relaxers today and what do you know my fever spikes this afternoon. back up to 101.5. The put me back on the pain pills and it drops down to 100 last check. I am so tired of all of this. My PS said if they could not get the infection cleared up they might have to take out the TE till they do. But he left to go out of town for the week so one of his partners is following it. I think I am ready for them just to take it and be done with it just so I do not have to worry about it any more. They have not started fills yet so we are now two weeks late on that. Thanks for listening as I have no where else to turn at 1 in the morning when you can not sleep at the hospital. Best wishes. HUGS to all
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2011 08:24PM dmho wrote: ((((((slinky))))) just wanted to say Best wishes.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2011 11:36AM dmho wrote: cling I had a LMX with recon on 1/31 and reduction on the right side. I came home the next day. I have had my kids and a close freind here to take care of things for me. Today is the first day that I have been able to move my left arm. I was able to fix myself a drink if I only used my right arm since about wed.. I am glad I had people around to help me. of course we were also snow in so that everyone was not going any where anyway. You might need help with your drains. I have been able to care for them on my own but it just depends on the placement. Each person is different. You do what is right for you there is no right or wrong.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2011 11:58PM dmho wrote: hi everyone I was wondering if any one had had one of your drains come lose? One of mine seem to have. I woke up from a nap and the bulb was no longer deflated. I tried to deflate it several times and all that happen was it would fill back up with a whistling sound. I call my PS and the office was closed so they sent my message to the one on call. When he call I explain it to him and he told me to hand pump it once an hour and make an appt. first thing Monday. I also told him that it was bleeding quite a bit from the area around the tube. Since I talked to him it is bleeding more I can tell that the tube is about five inches longer than it was. I have been running a low grade fever 99 to 100 off and on last night and today. I don't want to call back if it is nothing but I am worried about infection. I not sure what to do any advice would be appreciated. Best wishes
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2011 10:01AM dmho wrote: Thanks cmblastic, I am pretty sure I have pulled it out. Not all the way, but most of the way. Its on the side they did my reduction so It is harder to feel. I am not geting fluid out of it at all now. But I have notice the leakage around the opening is more when I hand pump it like they said to. I have been keeping the opening clean and keeping a clean gauze on it.  Thanks again. Best wishes
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2011 09:32PM dmho wrote: So now my drain has completly come out. I call my PS office and talk to whoever was on call. I think he was the same one I talked to yesterday. He told me there is no reason to worry. All I had to do was clean it good and keep it clean till monday. He said if my fever goes up then to call back, 99 - 100 is nothing to worry about. He sounded like he was so put out by me calling him. I wish I could talk to my BS but the way they do it is she handles all path. reports and the PS handles all the surgery.  The area around where the tupe was is all red and hot to the touch I tould him this but he said it would be fine till monday. So I guess I wait till monday and call first thing. One of my other drains is still draining a lot about 70 cc every 12 hours the other one hardly has 5 to 10 cc in 12 hours. If it was not for the drains I would be doing great. I have had very little pain today and am not as tired as I have been.  Best wishes to all.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2011 03:37PM dmho wrote: I am glad to hear I am not the only one who rtires easily. I try to do a few things around the house or run to the store and then I need a nap.  I felt that it was just me. Thanks ladies for letting me realize it ok. Bless you all. HUGS to each of you. Prayers for your continue healing.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2011 07:39PM dmho wrote: redsky sorry to hear it was postponed again. I know you must be really flustered. I will keep you in my prayers. I saw my BS to day and found out that they got it all. I will not have to do radiation. They did find quite a bit more DCIS then they thought was there so it is a good thing I went this route because they i would have ended up here in the long run. They did test the tissue they removed from the right side during the reduction and it was clear. I was very pleased . I then saw my PS he removed one drain but left the other because of the amount of fluid. He also said the skin around the incision has died and has to be removed so I head back to surgery tomorrow at 8:30. I am starting to feel that each time I take one step forward I get pull back two. Thanks everyone for your support. HUGS to all.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2011 11:28PM dmho wrote: As I read each story i realize just how different each of our stories are. Some heal with no trouble other with everything going wrong. I rejoice with each of you who have are getting along well and I prayer for each of you going through hardship. While I count my blessing because I am lucky they got all my DCIS out during my mastectomy. I have had so many set back that now I am feel good I look back and wonder where the last two weeks went. After I came home from the hospital last Wednesday I was rush to the ER Thursday night were I was readmitted to the hospital. I was there till yesterday. My bowels had basically shut down because of all the meds I have been on. I finally feel better than I have in two weeks. My PS took out my last drain today. I will have to wait at least six months for reconstruction. I know what I have gone through does not compare to what many of you are going through and I pray for each of you. Sending each of you blessing and lots of HUGS. Thanks for all the support.
Posts.Title: January 2011 Mastectomy ibcmets SuebeeBC
